abstract: Sri Lanka's election commissioner reports that authorities are investigating complaints about plans for deployment of military troops during upcoming presidential election; military flatly rejects claims that troops could be used to influence election results by discouraging ethnic Tamils from voting.
lead_paragraph: The Sri Lankan election commissioner said he had received complaints about the deployment of troops in the former conflict zones in the north and east of the country.
snippet: The Sri Lankan election commissioner said he had received complaints about the deployment of troops in the former conflict zones in the north and east of the country.

headline.main: Reports of Army Deployment in Sri Lanka Investigated Ahead of Election
headline.print_headline: Sri Lanka: Officials Investigating Reports on Troops Before Election
